result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwon D Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 31, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on February 6, 2023 at 08:45 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:58 PM 
Defendant Antwon D Johnson in court.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Antwon D Johnson.  Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Nelson request status be scheduled to allow time for discovery to be reviewed.
--no objection from ADA Beck

Mr. Johnson indicates that 'UPPER' is to be added to his address. 
recess: 3:00pm
NEXT: Status on 11/17/22 at 11:30am

JA's Review of 08/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/22) ML
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ml] Cases 22CF167 and 22CF168 called at 2:41PM
Defendant Antwon D Johnson in court.  Attorney Cassi Nelson. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Nelson advises that the Defense has received an offer, and requests that these files be scheduled for another Status Conference.
The State advises that the Defendant's pending extradition matter has been executed already, and inquires if there is any action that needs to be taken.

The State motions to dismiss the extradition file. The Court closes the extradition matter, and takes no further action. The Court states that the Clerk of Court's Office shall contact him if any further orders are needed for this file within the next week.

recess 2:43PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 10/06 at 2:30PM
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] cases #22CF167 and #22CF168 called at 11:40am 
Defendant Antwon D Johnson does not appear. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Nelson notes that Mr. Johnson telephoned earlier to court staff for this hearing, indicating that he does not have transportation to come to court. Through this she was able to obtain a new telephone number for Mr. Johnson and talk with him before the Court called the cases. Attorney Nelson provides information on Mr. Johnson's completion of the Minnesota cases he had been extradited there to appear at.  She requests scheduling of another status conference. 
The Court authorizes but stays warrants to the next hearing date and time.  
recess 11:43am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on August 1st at 11:00am --JA note in comments that warrants have been auhorized but stayed to this date
JA's Review of 06/17/2022 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (06/17) ML

ec; DA and Atty Nelson (6/8/22--ma)
for Continuance
to Adjourn
JA Follow-up 4/26/22: JA unable to find agreeable date in May 2022. Hearing to remain calendared for 6/9/22 at 8:30am...
from JESO advising def was picked up by Stearns County MN
We'll give it a try - JA - try to calendar something in May 2022.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter request from the defendant.

[ma] Cases 22CF167 & 22CF168 called at 11:30 AM 
Defendant Antwon D Johnson in court, in custody with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Case 22CF168:
Mr. Johnson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Waiver of Extradition occurs in Case 22CF167:
--The Court is satisfied that the person before it is the person wanted in another state
--Mr. Johnson waives extradition hearing
--Mr. Johnson endorses waiver of extradition documents
--Court endorses

The Court does not set bond.
recess: 11:40am 

NEXT:   Status Conference on 6/9/22 at 8:30am (via video, if Mr. Johnson is in custody elsewhere)

[ma] Cases 22CF167 & 22CF168 called at 2:23 PM 
Defendant Antwon D Johnson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Michael Witt  appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF168:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Defendant indicates that his mailing address is: 3284 N. 30th St. Milwaukee 53216
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Defendant

In Case 22CF168, the Court requires a $500 Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--maintain asbolute sobriety

************
As to Case 22CF167:
The Court reviews criminal complaint
Atty Witt submits additional documentation

The Court finds that the individual wanted in MN is the same as here before the Court in WI.

Defendant requests an extradition hearing be scheduled.

recess 2:39  pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing(22CF168)/Extradition Hearing(22CF167) on 4/12/22 at 11:30am
